history.text: Hello. Have you ever watched Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice?
No I haven't. What can you tell me about it?
Well Ben Affleck plays Batman/Bruce Wayne and Henry Cavill plays Superman/Clark Kent. It's the second installment in the DCExtended Universe following Man of Steel that came out in 2013.
That sounds interesting. What is the plot of this movie?

The plot deals with criminal mastermind Lex Luthor manipulating Batman into a preemptive battle with Superman, whom Lex Luthor is obsessed with defeating. Would you like to know how the moving was rated?
Sure, how was this movie rated?
Rotten Tomatoes gave the movie a 27% and average rating of 4.9/10. Metacritic Score gave the movie a 44/100 rating. Lastly, CinemaScore gave the movie a B rating.
Wow. Do you know why this movie got such low ratings?
One of the critical responses by a fan stated, "better than Man of Steel but below the high bar set by Dolan's Dark Knight." Therefore many believe that the movie could have been a lot better.
I can see that. Even though I haven't seen the movie, I don't personally see Ben Affleck as right for the role of Batman. How did people rate the role of Superman?

I am not sure about that but a key scene for the movie is when Batman realizes that Superman has become a controversial figure and sees him as an existential threat to humanity. I like this scene because this is when the "beef" between the two superheroes first begin
That sounds like a riveting scene! So what would you say this movie falls under, categorically speaking? (Thriller, romance, comedy, etc)
I would say this movie falls under a Thriller. Another part of the key scene is when Superman tries to expose Batman through Daily Planet articles.
It sounds like there's a lot of rivalry that takes place. Does this movie get violent at any point?
Yes it does. The two mighty superheroes get into serious combat and began trying to destroy one another.
Ah I see. So you said Superman tries to expose Batman through Daily Planet articles...does this mean the movie primarily takes place in Metropolis, as opposed to Gotham?
Yes. Another key scene is when Lex Luthor kidnaps Lois and Martha Kent to bring Superman out of exile.
Is Superman able to rescue them both?
Well there's a twist to it. Luthor demands that Superman kill Batman in exchange for Martha's life.
Oh no! Does Superman end up killing Batman?
Well Superman attempts to explain the situation to Batman but Batman fights him and eventually subdues him.
How does Batman subdue Superman?
I'm not sure with the details but eventually Batman saves Martha and Lex luthor gets arrested.
Do Batman and Superman ever become allies?
No superman is eventually pronounced dead and Batman shares his regret to Diana about how he failed Superman. He then comes up with a team of metahumans to protect the world in Superman's absence.
Who pronounces Superman dead? I thought he couldn't die, except to Kryptonite!
Well due to the scheme that Lex Luthor put in place, Batman had to leave and go save Martha. But Batman confronts Lex Luthor while he's in prison
What happens in this confrontation?

uid2response.feedback: Although the movie sounds interesting, the overall reviews from Rotten Tomatoes and Meta Critics tells me this film leaves much to be desired. I also can't see Ben Affleck as Batman, and Batman is my favourite DC character...so I don't think he'd do it justice.
